replies.body: I think TSM has a good chance of going to the finals (again) but C9 is going to have a fight on their hands.
I agree, but still feel we are heading toward the TSM v C9 final that we all expected. Personally I'm hoping for C9 v FLY, but TSM still looks to be the team to beat in NA.

TSM is the worst organization on the planet. They are responsible for Locodoco, one of the worst coaches, and never show up internationally. I think they'll give up game one, fumble in game two, and fail to come back in game three. It is going to be FLY vs C9 and to be completely honest I don't care which one wins. So long as TSM is kept from going to MSI I'm happy, if they do go to MSI prepare for NA to be the next wildcard region.

Best NA has done internationally is 2nd place this last MSI and 3rd place in the Season 1 "Worlds" where TSM placed 3rd.. I don't see C9 on any of that. NA has never really shown up at Worlds and there has only been 2 MSI's. Only difference is TSM has been consistent enough to go to every single worlds. No other team in the Worlds can say that. They just haven't been able to perform to that Standard in Worlds. Now don't give me the crap that at least C9 made it out of groups last year argument. Becuase, TSM and C9 had same record in groups. The difference is that while C9 had to play in same group as SKT (they didn't take a single game from SKT). TSM had RNG and SSG (they took one from SSG but RNG didn't drop one to them. So yay tie breaker.) Grant it if TSM beat RNG for that spot they probably woulda lost to SKT in first round of Knockouts. But, C9 got 3-0'd by SSG.
TSM won IEM katowice vs Team WE and got 1st place. Unless we dont count IEM as international competition anymore
C9 made it to worlds ever single year that they have been a team.... I don't see how that is any different than TSM making it each year as well...

My point is that TSM is shit while ANY other NA team would be better suited to go to international play other than them. I don't give a flying fuck who goes to worlds or MSI so long as it isn't shiTSM.

I think everyone's forgetting the C9 that took a game off of Samsung Blue in 2014 in the Quarterfinals of worlds with Hai's Mission Impossible Zed play. Sure CLG performed well at MSI and took 2nd. But MSI is hardly worlds. Statistically when the number of opposing teams goes from 16 to 8,  or 5 really if you throw out: 1. How terrible EU was, 2.The IWC team, 3. CLG itself its no wonder they did so well.

The faithful of old C9 (Lemon,Balls,Hai,Meteos,Sneaky) believe that they can come through again and upset TSM. FlyQuest vs. P1!  Meteos vs. Moon all day!!!

TSM is the only organization to make it to every world championship. While they never really show up internationally, NA never really does. Our biggest achievment was CLG getting 3-0 swept by SKT at MSI last year.

How Korea loses worlds? 1. Boost fly into quarter finals bo5. 2. Tell fly to lose first 2 games (shouldn't be hard vs korea). 3. Reverse sweep for win.
#NaStrat lol
This seems to be a very competitive playoff bracket.
